title.native: ゴールデンカムイ 第三期

description:
Separated from Sugimoto, Asirpa now travels toward the Russian border, focused on discovering more about her and her father’s involvement with the coded tattoos. But Sugimoto is determined to find and protect Asirpa! Along the way, he’ll discover new people, new cultures rich with history, and an unforgiving terrain. Will Sugimoto and Asirpa survive their journeys and reunite?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Circus
tags.description: Prominently features a circus.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Indigenous Cultures
tags.description: Prominently features real-life indigenous cultures.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

name.native: ソフィア・ゴールデンハンド

node.description:
__Current Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Website](https://723000451898910026.weebly.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/satorunoda)

Satoru Noda  is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known as the creator of the manga series [Golden Kamuy](https://anilist.co/manga/86559/Golden-Kamuy/), for which he won the 2016 Manga Taishō and the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.

He used to be the assistant of [Yasuyuki Kunitomo](https://anilist.co/staff/114715/Yasuyuki-Kunitomo) and [Mitsurou Kubo](https://anilist.co/staff/96926/Mitsurou-Kubo).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroekeisuke)

Currently freelance. Worked for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) from 2011 to 2017.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Website](https://thesixthlie.jp)

The Sixth Lie is a Japanese electronic rock band formed in May 2015 in Tokyo, Japan. Their music is known for its hybrid style inspired by the latest western music, and their overall science fiction-inspired theme connected to near future and outer space.

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._
**Shige Fukase** is a production manager and episode director.
